lines.text:
[preparing to kill Django]
Django, I think you should make a last request! I'll be glad to oblige you any way I can. Start praying if you like, I don't mind. It's a smart thing to do when you know that death is coming for you. How come you haven't you got your burial suit with you? We'll have to leave you to the vultures! So now, begin your prayer...
[shoots a side of Mercedes Zaro's cross]
I sure never thought I'd end up grave-digging and not even getting paid for it, either. Anyhow, it's better to be above ground doing that than below ground doing nothing.
If you're a coffin maker... sure did pick a good town to settle, sure did.
You can clean up the mess, now. But don't touch my coffin.

[to a gang]
A woman shouldn't be treated in that way.
It's not important. And if I bothered you, would you accept my apology?
I'm glad I made you feel like a real woman - very glad - I mean that.
Tell Jackson I'll be waiting at the cemetary. Understand? There's just the two of us now. I'll be waiting.
